Text: Trump is and always has been a moral issue. What contempt I have for every politician and journalist who has ever tried to ingratiate themselves to him or even strained to be ‘even-handed.' https://t.co/f3pJGIXu6l

The Gov't is highly concerned about a #COVID19 community cluster linked to a Lek Yuen Estate resident as it reflects some characteristics not seen before, Chief Executive #CarrieLam says  https://t.co/TvefwAJh3G https://t.co/0XB2DRDWbh

Today is International Sex Workers' Day.UNAIDS and @GlobalSexWork call on countries to take immediate, critical action to protect the health and rights of sex workers during the #COVID19 pandemic. #ISWD2020
If you're more upset that Trump waved a Bible in front of a church than you are about leftist arsonists setting that church on fire, you might be a Democrat! https://t.co/GlBCEurdu1

@FutureGenCymru Commissioner @sophiehowe calls on us all to do the right thing in her 2020 Report. Our CEO Carole-Anne Davies welcomes the report saying the need to think and plan for the future has never been so relevant (https://t.co/xExP6aoEHy) #buildbackbetter #covid19

We need the BAME report on COVID-19 now. We need to ensure ALL MPs can vote safely today. We need Boris Johnson to condemn Donald Trump in the strongest possible terms regardless of where this leaves a trade agreement. These 3 things are all absolutely crucial today
He didn't need to say anything, most religious leaders use a time like that to try to impress with flowery words. The picture of .@potus holding the Bible paints 1000 words! https://t.co/FzKNPR7int

this moment does not merely reflect the character of President Trump as an individual politicianit also reflects the character of today's Republican Party - which nominated and elected him, and continues to support and sustain him now

Trump just had peaceful demonstrators viciously attacked.  No, Mr. President. This is not a dictatorship. This is the United States of America. Our citizens have a constitutional right to peacefully protest. It's called the First Amendment.
